The NOS has confirmed that it is going ahead with its plan for the
Sweelinck commemoration and that this would shortly he communicated
to the Administrative Office in accordance with the procedure outlined
above for composers falling into category (l).
The Bureau also examined a proposal from Mr Mertens, Director
of Programmesj BRT, that, in conformity with a wish expressed after
last year's successful Beethoven International Piano Competition, similar
competitions should be organized each year. Mr Mertens proposed that
for 1972 a competition dedicated to Scriabin's piano music might be
appropriate, but the Bureau felt that this was too difficult for young
people and recommended to the Committee that the proposal of the music
experts for the commemoration of Scriabin in 1972 be implemented.
As regards the "Troubadour" project on page l6 of the report,
it is now known that the BRT, ARD, BBC, NOS, NRK and RTB
have nominated musicologists who are at present seeing what their own
countries could provide in this context. It will be recalled that in
due course a meeting of the organizations expressing an interest in
taking an active part in this series is proposed under the chairmanship
of Mr Mertens (BRT).
On the subject of the "Italian Madrigal" project the situation
is that details of the proposals from a number of organizations are in
the hands of the co-ordinator of the project, Maestro Giazotto (RAI)
and his suggestions are currently awaited. By way of information the
following have been put forward in this respect :
approximately 250 assorted madrigals
one 30', one U0' programme
excerpts from Vecchi's "Le Veglie di Siena"
and excerpts from Banchieri's "II Festino"
a considerable number of madrigals
three 30' programmes
ARD
BBC
CBC (Canada)
ORTF
SSR (RSI)
